results.title: The AIF's Great Route March : Review No 460
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cinesound Review”.
This Cinesound newsreel consists of footage of the AIF’s Great Route March - a training march across the Blue Mountains to Bathurst which took twelve days over one hundred and thirty miles.

results.title: The Aid trap. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Judith Weymont, Chris Bryer, Derek Jones and Yorkshire Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Politics of food”.
Wealthy western nations in more recent times, have given aid to poorer nations struck by disasters such as famine, flood and war. The primary purpose of aid is to strengthen a political relationship between allies. Both parts of the video compare situations in Kerala and Bangladesh in terms of food distibution and programmes to prevent problems caused by overpopulation. At the time of production, food distribution in Bangladesh was hampered by corrupt political infra-structures in some areas, while education was not a high priority. In Kerala the effects of sound educational programmes and a fairer distribution of resources was examined.

results.title: The Agrarian revolution
results.creator_credit: Hugh Baddeley Productions and W. Hugh Baddeley
results.brief_description: Deals with the enclosure of common lands, one of the most dramatic happenings in British history, and describes the changes in agriculture over the last two hundred and fifty years. Commentary by spoken by Dick Graham.

results.title: The Age of revolutions: W. Blake, poet and painter
results.creator_credit: Edward Hayward, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Relates two sides of Blake’s work which are normally considered separately - his art, particularly his illustrations, and his poetry. Concentrates on “Songs of Innocence and Experience” and the much closer relationship between text and illustrations than usually admitted. The delicate colours of the illustrations, often no more than half an inch across, are shown in close-up.

results.title: The Age of plywood
results.brief_description: The manufacture and uses of plywood. Every stage in the manufacture of plywood, from the journey of the log from the forest, its peeling or slicing into veneer, and processing to various grades of plywood. The uses of plywood in homes, commercial buildings and building projects, for panelling, furniture, structural work, concrete formwork and boat building.

results.title: The Age of Aquarius
results.brief_description: This survey of the lifestyles of the young focuses on three communes, each of which represents its search for a new way because their lives have been meaningless and empty. The narrator points out that young people believe their search for The Age of Aquarius will save them, if not mankind, from society’s destruction.

results.title: The Afternoon house
results.brief_description: An experimental film showing the fascination of an old house and its garden for a small girl. She goes there to retrieve a lost ball, and wanders about looking at the trees and flowers first, and then going through the Georgian doorway and up the staircase exploring the rooms, looking at the pictures, trying an old fashioned cane chair and then, becoming engrossed in her surroundings, she knocks over a vase of daisies and is frightened as she sees ugly masks staring at her from the walls. She dashes downstairs and out the gate without stopping even to retrieve her ball. Photographed by Mike Browning, music by Allan Lee.

results.title: The African scene: youth builds a nation in Tanzania
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Visual Education Center, Toronto and H Lemieux
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of “nation-building” by showing girls of a government-operated secondary school in Tanzania helping their country to develop a better standard of living. Also shows use of co-operative farming as a means of increasing agricultural production and improving rural life.

results.title: The Affair-Quandary
results.brief_description: A woman is in a quandary about whether to confront her husband with her suspicions that he is having an affair. Her husband’s quandary is whether to tell his wife, leave his wife or break off the affair. This program will interest people in relationships, educators, counsellors, community health and women’s organisations and marriage counselling services.

results.title: The Adze and the chainsaw
results.creator_credit: Tom Williamson, New Zealand National Film Unit and Pat McGuire
results.brief_description: Explores the question of whether Maori art should retain its traditional forms, or reflect changing experiences and new influences. Sequences include students making murals combining Maori legends with modern day experiences and the restoration of carvings using new techniques under the supervision of a traditional Maori artist. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels. Camera by Bayly Watson, edited by Ross Chambers, researched by Judith Wright.
